note.p: Education: Mr Millington's School, Enfield, Middlesex; Sidney Sussex College, Cambridge (matriculated 1661); Gray's Inn (admitted 1663); Middle Temple (admitted 1671)
Career: Called to the Bar (1670); left his books to the Royal Society (1679)
Memberships: FRCP ( Fellow of the Royal College of Physicians )
Proposers: Robert Hooke (08 November 1677 or 17 January 1678)
Paid two contributions before his death.
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; Venn; Foster; Hunter; Ward; DNB (father's entry); GI; MT
References: J Buchanan-Brown, 'The Books Presented to the Royal Society by John Aubrey, FRS' in NR 1973-4 vol 28 pp 167-193
A C S, 'Notes on the Foundation and History of the Royal Society' in NR 1938 vol 1 pp 32-36
